moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6: I bring up my knight to protect the pawn...
moves.3. b3 Nf6: ...and its twin to attack my opponent's...
moves.4. Bc4: ...but as he fails to cover it...
moves.9. Re1: ...but he lines up another form of attack...
moves.9... Be7: ...but I don't move my bishop far enough...
moves.10. Nxe5 Nxe5 11. Rxe5: ...and despite the knight-for-knight swap, I lose a pawn.
moves.15... Be6: Now I pressurise his pawn with my bishop...
moves.17. a3 Bd7: Now I retreat the bishop to attck his rook...
moves.18. Rf1: ...but he moves his out of the way...
moves.19. Qc2 Rfe8: ...and double up on the e-file, lining up a potential checkmate...
moves.20. Nd2: ...but he realises what I am doing...
moves.22... Re7e2: ...I move my rook to the 7th rank...
moves.23... Qxg2#: ...allows me to move in for the kill.
